channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: US coronavirus task force reports reveal dire reality shown to Trump as he spewed positive message
US passes 6 million confirmed cases
With Canada and Mexico borders closed, Americans are trapped in their own healthcare system
item.description: "Want to hear the joke about insulin?" goes the bleak gag about America's drug prices. "You have to go to Canada to get it."

item.title: Biden condemns violence and asks Americans: 'Do you really feel safe under Donald Trump?'
Portland protest shooting death: Here's what we know
New video shows moments before deadly shooting in Portland
item.description: Disturbing new video shows the moments before a fatal shooting happened in Portland, Oregon, during protest clashes that left one person dead. Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden released a statement condemning the deadly violence and encouraged President Donald Trump to follow suit.

item.title: India accuses China of 'provocative military movements' on border
item.description: India on Monday accused Chinese troops of taking "provocative" actions near a disputed border high in the Himalayas, violating previous deals between the two nuclear-armed rivals intended to ease tensions in the region.

item.title: Why are India and China sparring at the border?
item.description: Two nuclear powers. One invisible line that separates them, high in the Himalayas. Decades of disputes over it. Here's what you need to know about the contested border between India and China.

item.title: The 10 US Senate seats most likely to flip in 2020
Appeals court denies Michael Flynn and DOJ's effort to end his case
item.description: A federal appeals court ruled Monday against Michael Flynn and the Justice Department in their request to quickly shut down his criminal case.

item.title: Woman arrested for 'obscene' nude video on Indian holy bridge
item.description: A 27-year-old Frenchwoman has been arrested for making a nude video of herself on a holy bridge over India's Ganges River.

item.title: Australian journalist and TV host detained in China
item.description: A prominent Australian journalist has been detained in China as tensions between the two countries rise.

item.title: Suburban Trump 2016 voter has a message for the President
item.description: 2016 Trump voter Mary Anderson tells CNN's Brianna Keilar what she needs to see from President Trump to secure her vote in November.

item.title: House Republican No. 2 deletes doctored video of activist after Twitter flags it
item.description: Twitter labeled a video promoted by House Minority Whip Steve Scalise of a progressive activist interviewing Joe Biden about police funding "manipulated content," and Scalise later deleted the tweet Sunday night.

item.title: New Chinese rules could complicate a sale of TikTok's US business
item.description: China appears to have complicated efforts to sell TikTok to an American company by introducing new rules that could allow Beijing to veto any potential deal.

item.title: First Israeli commercial flight between Israel and UAE takes to the skies
item.description: The first Israeli commercial flight from Israel to the United Arab Emirates (UAE) took to the skies on Monday, after an agreement to normalize relations between the two countries.

item.title: McDonald's strikes back against former CEO
item.description: McDonald's isn't backing down from its push to claw back millions of dollars in severance pay from its former CEO, Steve Easterbrook.

item.title: Schiff: Intel belongs to American people, not Trump
item.description: House Intelligence Chairman Adam Schiff says it is possible the House could decide to subpoena Director of National Intelligence John Ratcliffe to testify before Congress, a day after the nation's top intelligence office informed Congress it'll no longer deliver in-person briefings on election security issues.

item.title: US House committee to subpoena postmaster general for 'withholding' documents from Congress
item.description: The House Committee on Oversight and Reform plans to issue a subpoena to Postmaster General Louis DeJoy on Wednesday, over documents its chairwoman said DeJoy "has been withholding from Congress," the committee said Monday.

item.title: Former Indian president dies at 84
item.description: Former Indian president Pranab Mukherjee has died at the age of 84, according to a tweet from his son.

item.title: Champagne makers are throwing out grapes. Here's why
item.description: The 2020 champagne harvest is underway with a promising output but champagne producers have agreed to throw out much of the harvest to keep the prices high to compensate for the drop in demand due to the Covid-19 pandemic. CNN's Melissa Bell explains.

item.title: Amazon completes critical step toward drone delivery
item.description: Amazon received a critical certificate from the Federal Aviation Administration on Saturday, bringing it a step closer to launching drone delivery in the United States.

item.title: French prosecutor opens official investigation into magazine's portrayal of Black lawmaker as slave
item.description: The Paris prosecutor's office has opened an investigation over illustrations in a right-wing magazine that portrayed Black politician Danièle Obono as an 18th-century slave.

item.title: Rare 'singing' dog, thought to be extinct in wild for 50 years, still thrives
item.description: This dog can sing ... or at least it can yodel.

item.title: New premier named in Lebanon hours before Macron's visit
item.description: Lebanon's leaders have designated the country's ambassador to Germany, Mustapha Adib, as the new premier, hours before the arrival of French President Emmanuel Macron in Beirut.

item.title: Watch Elon Musk show how the Neuralink brain implant works — using a pig
item.description: A pig named Gertrude was the star of the show when Elon Musk debuted a working demo of his latest technology moonshot, a new kind of implantable chip for the brain.

item.title: Denzel Washington, who once paid Chadwick Boseman's tuition, pays tribute
item.description: Chadwick Boseman was referred to as "the next Denzel Washington" and the first one has remembered Boseman as a "gentle soul."

item.title: 'Hotel Rwanda' film hero Paul Rusesabagina arrested
item.description: Paul Rusesabagina, who saved hundreds of Rwandans during the genocide by sheltering them in the hotel he managed, and saw his story made into the Hollywood film 'Hotel Rwanda', has been arrested on terror related offenses, Rwandan authorities announced.

item.title: CNN's Dana Bash pushes Wisconsin GOP senator on violence in Kenosha
item.description: CNN's Dana Bash speaks to Sen. Ron Johnson (R-WI) about the violence that flared in Kenosha, Wisconsin, following the police shooting of Jacob Blake. Kyle Rittenhouse, 17, is accused of shooting and killing two men and injuring a third Tuesday night.

item.title: Lionel Messi fails to attend Barcelona pre-season training
item.description: Barcelona forward Lionel Messi did not attend pre-season training on Monday, a club source has confirmed to CNN Sport.

item.title: Here's why Adele was wearing Bantu knots, a Jamaican flag bikini top and other carnival wear
item.description: Adele caused quite the stir on social media Sunday after posting a picture of herself on Instagram wearing Bantu knots, a Jamaican flag bikini top and other carnival wear popular in Afro-Caribbean cultures.

item.title: CNN fact-checker: As journalists we must stand up for truth
item.description: Brian Stelter speaks to CNN fact-checker Daniel Dale, who went viral after fact-checking the Republican National Convention.

item.title: India's economy shrinks at the fastest pace on record
item.description: India's economy contracted at the quickest pace on record in the second quarter, as lockdowns that were imposed to help control the spread of coronavirus decimated consumer spending and investment.

item.title: Whoopi Goldberg wants Disney to build a Wakanda theme park in honor of Chadwick Boseman
item.description: "The View" co-host Whoopi Goldberg is calling on Disney to build a Wakanda theme park in honor of the late actor Chadwick Boseman.

item.title: This endangered penguin loves to watch shows about penguins
item.description: Pierre the penguin loves to watch shows and documentaries about other penguins, as he recuperates from a daring journey from islands in the Indian or South Atlantic Ocean, in Australia's Perth Zoo.

item.title: Town bills teen $2,500 for police overtime due to Black Lives Matter protest she organized
item.description: A New Jersey teen organized a Black Lives Matter and affordable housing protest on July 25, over what she says is a lack of affordable housing that disproportionately prevents Black people, Native Americans, and other people of color from living in Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey.

item.title: Huge empty 'ghost' cruise ships lure tourists
item.description: Gaze out to the English Channel from the southwest coast of the UK right now and you might see something unexpected -- a series of gigantic cruise ships haunting the horizon.

item.title: This young entrepreneur skipped college to create robotic limbs that users can control with their minds
item.description: Ten years ago, Easton LaChappelle was a teen watching YouTube videos in his Colorado bedroom on how to build robot arms from LEGOs.

item.title: 10-year-old challenges rock legend Dave Grohl to drum battle
item.description: Prodigious drummer Nandi Bushell loves the Foo Fighters and the band's frontman accepted her online challenge.

item.title: Pro tennis divided by launch of breakaway players' association
item.description: Tennis has been left divided following the launch of a breakaway players' association, with Roger Fereder and Rafael Nadal among those to criticize its formation.

item.title: Channing Tatum wrote a children's book and dedicated it to his daughter
item.description: Channing Tatum is releasing his first children's book, "The One and Only Sparkella," dedicated to his 6-year-old daughter, Everly.

item.title: Angel City: Disruptors plan Hollywood ending for LA women's soccer club
item.description: For Alexis Ohanian last summer, it started with a simple phone call. The entrepreneur and co-founder of Reddit was in London and his friend wanted him to come to Paris, "He's like, you're an idiot if you don't come down to watch the USA play France."

item.title: Brian Austin Green on possible Megan Fox reconciliation: 'Never say never'
item.description: It sounds like Brian Austin Green hasn't totally given up on his marriage.

item.title: As Trump was painting a rosy picture of the pandemic, he was getting increasingly dire reports in July and August
item.description: As President Donald Trump was painting a positive picture of the coronavirus pandemic and urging states to reopen the nation's businesses and schools, data from the White House coronavirus task force released Monday shows he was getting increasingly dire reports about the spread of the pandemic in July and August.

item.title: Dr. Birx to Americans: Wear a mask -- even around family
item.description: Just over seven months ago, no one in the US had a confirmed case of Covid-19. On Monday, the US topped 6 million cases of coronavirus, which has killed over 183,000 people and left many young adults with long-term problems.

item.title: Trump keeps wrongly describing Biden's shutdown comments
item.description: President Donald Trump keeps wrongly describing what his Democratic opponent, former Vice President Joe Biden, said about the idea of imposing a "shutdown" to combat the coronavirus.

item.title: Why a Covid-19 vaccine will likely require two doses
item.description: When a coronavirus vaccine comes on the market, people will likely need two doses, not just one -- and that could lead to complications. CNN senior medical correspondent Elizabeth Cohen reports.

item.title: The country with the fastest growing caseload in the world
item.description: • Live updates: US surpasses 6 million cases • New task force reports show dire reality Trump saw while spewing positivity

item.title: Biden asks America: 'Do you really feel safer under Trump?'
item.description: • Man killed in Portland shooting mourned by far-right group • What we know about the shooting • LIVE: Mayor calls Trump visit's timing 'wrong'

item.title: The 10 US Senate seats most likely to flip in 2020
item.description: • Analysis: This is the widest presidential battleground in a very long time
